alert.note: Alert for Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 02 at 3:58AM EDT until July 02 at 5:15AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR WEST CENTRAL CLINTON COUNTY... At 358 AM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Closure of local routes have occurred. Flash flooding of area roads, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that are experiencing flash flooding include... Merrill and Ellenburg Mountain. Route 374 has been closed in both directions from Star Road to Plank Road due to flooding. Secondary roads, including Plank Road, Peets Road, and Bradley Pond Road may also be impacted. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads, especially at nighttime when it is difficult to see flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
